comment: Great professor I took him online for my senior seminar. Very easy class and instructions are always straightforward on what is required. Stay on your assignments no make ups or missing assignments. Overall great professor and gives great feedback

He was a good teacher, made lectures not super boring. Lots of group work, but it's all online, a group discussion once a week. There is a quiz every other week, open note but can be tricky and no tests. He was a good guy but sort of pushed his political opinion on us too much, made me uncomfortable at times.

Dr. White was a great and funny professor. His lectures were really interesting, and his PowerPoints were not boring. At the beginning of the year, you're put into a group for your weekly discussions. Quizzes are sometimes difficult if you don't pay attention to his lectures, but do the study guide, and it'll help. Really recommend him:) He's nice!

Dr. White was great! His lectures were informative and hilarious. He is very relatable with students. There is a lot of group work with discussions which can be confusing in the beginning but once you get the hang of it, it is a breeze. All the other quizzes and assignments are relevant to what is discussed in class and have clear guidelines.

You'll have discussions each week, ones in which are collaborated by you and others. Quizzes every other week. Extra credit opportunities are offered. Being a leader or secretary will set you up for success. He does not take attendance, but he does give test answers in class. Fairly easy. The tests are slightly hard, but he wants to see you win.

Very easy class. I stopped going after about the first three weeks and still maintained my A+. He assigns a group at the beginning of the semester so that you can make a group discussion posts. Quiz every other week, very easy. No lockdown browser. Lectures are very interesting, as well as the topics in the class.

One easy discussion a week with your group, and a quiz every two weeks which was open note. That's literally it. No tests or finals or essays, he was super sweet and you could easily end up with over an A in this class. Attendance wasn't mandatory as you can get answers from the textbook. 100% would take again, easy and insightful class!

The tests and quizzes were pretty difficult, especially if you did not show up to the classes. He gives extra credit on the tests and gives the answers at the beginning of some classes. Do your readings because the class is very textbook-heavy. Tests were online and were not locked down or recorded. There was also no final exam. Lots of group work.
Very discussion heavy and lots of group projects. Great professor and very funny. BEWARE because the quizzes are so hard.

Does his best to respond to student emails, to make helpful comments on coursework, to make suggestions on major assignments, and to alert students ahead of time on what they can do to improve in the course. I have taken him before & has always been such a great help me. He truly loves teaching & helping students become successful! One of the best!

It is fast to take this class over the summer semester, but that is expected with ANY summer class. The material is interesting and discussions are engaging.

There is one big final paper, but if you reach out to him beforehand he will 100% help you improve on what you already have. I would love to take this prof again.

LOTS of group work, which is a hurdle, but as long as you have a good group you'll be fine. Lectures were okay, I didn't feel like I learned a lot in them most of the time and there were times when I got bored, but as long as you do the assignments and extra credit you should be fine. I ended up with over 100% in the class.

Attendance isn't mandatory and I loved that he taught from a free online textbook. You're put in groups at the beginning of the semester and that's your group until the end of the semester. He provides extra credit opportunities every week and course work is very easy. There's also no midterm or final exam, the course consists of 8 quizzes. 10/10!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Teaches research methods. Encouraged students to email him for help & feedback. As long as you went to class & took what he said into consideration, you will pass. Weekly written assignments with 3-4 questions & a final research proposal paper. The weekly assignments were used to help students start/finish the final paper. Super easy and manageable

Prof. White was an amazing prof. This class was super easy, all you had to do was one discussion post every week with the group he assigned. He assigned take home quiz's every now and then and they were super simple. The best part was NO TESTS! Super funny guy and very easy class i suggest taking prof white.

He's a great teacher, def recommend him. His class is pretty easy, take notes and pay attention to his class sometimes the answer to the quizzes has to do with the lecture. The quizzes are open notes and semi-easy, also most questions will be from the book and they can be very confusing.

He is a great professor. Attendance was mandatory, but I did not mind going to his class. Although he assigned a lot of things, they all were helpful in the end. Also, everything he assigned was not too difficult.

He flies through his lectures, so take pictures. There are videos embedded that are funny, but at times the lectures can get boring. Attendance will count against you, but he used online attendance quizzes. He makes his own quizzes.. but there are lots of extra credit opportunities. He's a very caring and understanding teacher. Pretty easy A. :)

Personally, this class was not fun, but it was an easy A. If you are looking to get an easy A then do the work, extra credit, and quizzes, and you will be just fine. There is no final, and quizzes were open notes, but you HAVE TO TAKE NOTES. Other than that it was an easy A. Oh and he was very good at responding to emails.

Attendance equals 50 pts, 1 absence = -10 pts. Group discussion are okay, depends on group members make sure to establish clear rules. PPTs not shared after class so take pictures. If absence is excused he will send PPT but has little info. Quizzes are tricky. Lectures are good and uses videos. Manageable workload.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Just weekly group discussion posts and 6 quizzes. They're online and open note, but beware most questions are straight from the textbook and not mentioned in lectures. Lots of heavy extra credit opportunities, just one brought my grade up 8 points. Overall, Prof. White is chill and the content isn't very difficult to understand and engage with.

Class was not too difficult overall, but his quizzes can be extremely confusing. The way that some of the quiz questions are worded can be tough to navigate. He could also do a way better job when it comes to teaching during his lectures, and also post the powerpoints to D2L.

This course consists of lectures, GROUP discussion posts every week, readings, 7 online quizzes, and extra credit. Attendance is mandatory. The quizzes are easy but the wording tends to be confusing. DO THE STUDY GUIDES!! Overall, great professor but he could do a better job at explaining material in lectures and quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: His class was super easy and you only have one discussion per week thats with a group. Make sure you go to class because the quizzes are on his lectures and he doesn't put them on D2L, so the only way you will get information is if you go to class. He's also very understanding and not a tough grader at all.

His class is very easy but the only thing is that his test dont really line up with the lecture sometimes or his study guide which was done by his student teacher but now they left and the class average went up tremendously. It's supper easy other than that and great opportunities for extra credit.
Hands down one of the most caring, accommodating, and helpful professors I have ever had. I highly recommend.

I enjoyed this class. It was very lecture heavy, so you have to make sure to attend all of the classes. We took  quizzes inside the classroom that were based on the lectures. The quizzes we took outside of the classroom were a little difficult. Just pay attention and take notes and you'll do fine.

I took him for SOCI3380. He's a really easy grader as long as you know what you're doing, i got 100s on everything except one of the MC Exams. He's also pretty understanding if you miss something to a certain extent. One discussion post a week + 3 replies and 3 papers throughout the semester + one 10 page term paper. You need all 3 books tho.

Dr. White cares about what he is talking about and in turn so do you. You are mainly graded on discussion posts you do with a team and a few quizzes and one huge essay. The work is easy enough, just keep up with your readings and try to get to as many lectures as possible and you should get an easy A!

I put a minimal amount of effort into this class and still made an A. There was a lot of reading, but honestly just going to class and quickly skimming through the chapters was enough to get a B on the quizzes. Weekly group-discussion boards and a final 8-page research paper. Lecture heavy, but overall, a very simple class. Definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: This class is the epitome of indoctrination. We "learn" if you can call it that a ton of false information that is passed along as fact when in reality it is not. The professor isn't a bad dude other than him inserting and pushing his politics. The class is easy but if you aren't completely gone mentally prepare to roll your eyes a ton.

This class was awful. I had no idea what we were talking about, quizzes were super hard and the amount of reading each week was ridiculous. Long and hard discussion posts due weekly. Multiple very long articles on top of textbook chapters every week. Please do not take race and ethnicity with Dr. White. This class has caused me so much stress.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I loved Dr. Whites Sociology of Violence class. He gave us the option of coming in person or being 100% online due to the pandemic. He responded quickly to emails and had phone conferences with students. Very understanding, would give extensions if asked for and gave a reason.

Its hard not to get an 100. You do a DB with your group, due every Friday at 9 pm and respond to 3 other groups DB posts and have a reading quiz every other week. Textbook is free and online. Quizlet is your friend. Take him please.

I'm going to be totally honest, this class was incredibly easy, but that does not take away from the fact that it is pretty enjoyable and you learn plenty of useful information about society. I took this class during Fall of 2020, so it was fully online. Weekly group assignments but they are super easy. Weekly video lectures but they are great.

Dr. W is so nice and down to earth. I took his soci 1101. We have quizzes every other week ( quizlet helps!) theyre super easy. And discussion post every week which are also easy. I really cant find anything negative to say about his teaching. Hes a very understanding professor. Take him if you can!

I loved this professor. There is a 30 question quiz every 2 weeks and they are always easy. His lectures are short (the longest one we had all year was 12 slides). He is very understanding and a sweet guy. There is a discussion every week but it is not hard. You get extra credit if you respond to people. I would 100% recommend!

My favorite class ever. I took it online so I never got to actually meet him but i loved his class. Super easy. Group discussions every week and a quiz every 2 weeks. He posts lectures online and explains everything in a very simple way, which is nice. Take him if you can, youll love it.

This professor was a very easy professor. I made 100s on all discussion posts. As long you follow the basic instructions he gives, you will be able to make all 100s too. The quizzes/tests (same thing in the class) are sometimes easy and sometimes the questions aren't very straight forward. You will have to watch the videos he posts in order to pass
Professor White is the best professor ever. He really cares about his students and is really passionate about his class. It's very easy to pass this class!!!!
He is such a good person and care about the lives of all!

Professor White is very communicative and nice. Weekly work consists of one discussion and one quiz. There are 4 "short response" assignments throughout the semester but they take 1-2 hours tops. Highly recommend him if you need an extra class this semester. He also provides extra credit opportunities. You'd have to try to get a bad grade here.
Loved Dr. White! Easy A, inspirational, and accommodating. Take him if you have to take SOCI1101!!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: This Professor was really great! He graded attendance, group discussions due every week and pop quizzes on every Friday (open note open book). This class is very easy!

This class is really easy. We have a group project grade, quiz or "test" grades, and attendance grades. He only takes attendance on D2L every Monday so you really don't have to be in class for attendance unless you know someone that can send you the code if you decide not to go. Test just like notes. Must be in class Wed's for group assignments.

This Soci class was the easiest one I've taken by far. His test were very easy if you would take notes in class. However, he does do attendance via d2l every Monday morning so you have to be present in class. Also he doesn't use the book much and alot of the class is lectured base other than that it was a very easy to pass class. recommend taking.

this semester was weird because his schedule got messed up so we had a quiz/test every week instead of every other week. mon is lecture, wed is group discussion, fri is quiz. he goes through the ppts so fast and its not online either so the book is your best bet. overall, an interesting guy and the class was very easy
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: doesnt actually teach you have to do everything at home
He is an amazing teacher. I took him for Senior Seminar online and he was great. He was an easy grader, and is a really understanding person. I highly recommend taking him

I really enjoyed Dr. White! I have taken him 3 times now and each class is great! His assignments are not too hard. There is a lot of writing, but they are not too challenging. The final is a final paper that you choose the topic. I would definitely buy the book, you'll need it for the quizzes.

Professor White was hands down one of the best professor's I've ever had! If you show up you'll pass. He doesn't make the class hard or boring. I looked forward to class every Monday and Wednesday. Monday's were for lectures and Wednesday's were for group discussions. My minor is now sociology because of him. Very passionate and inspirational!

Easiest class I took my first semester here. Exams were easy and were online, and maybe 3 writing assignments were given (250 words min.) He was very nice, but I personally found his lectures and heavy use of buzzfeed to get old QUICK. Class had 250 people, class is an easy A.
Great online professor and very organized. Weekly discussions and online tests/papers but all very interesting.

He is by far one of my favorite teachers I've ever had. Even though there were 250+ people in my class, he still made it feel small by having open discussions in class. He's also very caring, friendly, and will do anything he can to help you!! Definitely a 10/10, take his class if it's open!!

What a great professor! His class is definitely an easy A: a few tests, written assignments, and in class discussions once a week, but I learned SO MUCH in this class. He cares about what he teaches about and it is obvious in his lectures. Very eye-opening, and an awesome person! Would recommend.

RECOMMEND!! If you are looking for an easy A, he's the professor you need. 3 writing assignments (only have to be 250 words) and he basically gives you a 100 for turning them in on time, and 5 online tests that can be found on quizlet. Weekly group discussions that you get a 100 for showing up to. No midterm, no final.

Take this professor!!! He is so chill and laid back. All the tests are online so you can use your textbook. He gives so many extra credit opportunities and hes a very nice guy. We have group discussions every week but theyre super easy. I recommend 100%

TAKE. Discussion post and writing assignment due each week, very easy to do. Tests are all on quizlet. Easy grader and is always behind on grading but to make up for it, he gives you 100s lol so TAKE HIM. I enjoy this class so much because it's easy and you actually learn something. Really nice guy too.
Great teacher, quizlet based test and textbook based. Gives a lot of extra credit.

I took SOCI1101 with Prof White. He was straightforward with assignments and graded a little tougher than expected. If you follow directions to the T and read the powerpoints as you do the work you'll pass easily.

All of the 7 tests were on quizlet and there was at least one writing assignment every week. The class isn't hard at all, however, he sometimes grades assignments more harshly than others without a good explanation.

14 discussion posts, 9 written assignments, and 7 tests. Overall, it was fairly easy. The grading criteria was clear, but I sometimes got frustrated with the lack of explanation when I did not receive a high b or a on an assignment. The assignments were easy and the tests were as well. One exam gets dropped and extra credit was offered. Recommend!

This was an extremely frustrating class. His grading is inconsistent and he leaves little to no constructive feedback. I put effort into all written assignments and discussions, so it was very frustrating and confusing to get 100s one week and 60s the next. I will not be taking him again and do not recommend him.
TAKE HIM. This class was awesome. Every week you either have a test or writing assignment and both are easy A's. Offers so much extra credit. He is willing to work with you for the grade you want.

Outstanding class and professor. Dr White is amazing. His class is interesting and that makes it easy. I would take this class again if I could! I wouldn't call it an easy A because he challenges you to think critically but as long as you try it'll be a breeze. Super understanding, genuine, and intelligent.

Mr. White is a great professor. I would definitely recommend him because his class is fairly simple and easy. There is no final, and the tests are online. There are simple written assignments that have a minimum requirement of 250 words. . Attendance is important because it is 50 points. And discussions are group activities and huge grade booster.

He is such a great professor!! This class was honestly a breath of fresh air. As long as you show up you should make an A. A lot of the tests come from quizlet or directly from the book. Very sweet guy & he's extremely woke on social issues which I appreciated.

Dr. White is awesome. He makes you think.. I learned so much in this class! All tests are online and pretty easy. Hes hilarious and very understand if you ever have an issue with the class. Extra credit is always an option too! Loved him
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: This class is interesting and super easy. Quiz answers straight from the textbook or on quizlet. I took it online and there were no tests, only discussions and quizzes. I loved this class.

Dr. White is easily one of my favorite professors at KSU. His class requires alot of work but the work is super easy and you will learn. There's alot of papers and tests but the papers are 250 words and the tests are online. His class is the best. I've taken sociology twice, first time I failed. This time was a 95.
He was a great professor and its an easy class.

This online class was wonderful! You have a discussion weekly, and you "lead" a discussion one time during the semester with a group. The quizzes definitely take some thinking, but they're not impossible. Just make sure you read the book and you will do fine. I really enjoyed his class!

I loved this class! His lectures were informational yet fun because he incorporated videos to aid his topics. There are about 7 tests & a few written assignments that you must do but they are not very hard just be sure to get the textbook! Attendance is mandatory especially on discussion days. Great teacher & definitely taking him again!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Attendance is mandatory, but I usually finished homework for other classes during this class.  Easy writing assignment every other week, group discussion on weeks there isn't a writing assignment. Test are online and every other week over two chapters, as long as you skim/read they are easy A's. Super easy class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: A cool guy who gives easy grades. If you show up you pass. If you miss more than 5 classes you fail the class. All tests are online. No final. Papers are easy and minimum 250 words. His lectures are interesting.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: I really enjoyed this class! The professor does a really good job of making the class interesting. Tests are easy and he does not grade harshly on the written assignments. There are discussions once a week and you will lose points if you miss.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Easy teacher, show up to class and somewhat pay attention and youre bound to pass.

This class is ridiculously easy! Show up to class everyday because  he does attendance questions  & group discussions that will hurt your grade if absent. He is very funny and nice. He truly cares about his students. He turns a huge classroom into a discussion. Lots of extra credit at the end of the course. Take Him!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: So kind and really cares about your well being in and outside of class. Online exams and essays that are all easy if you just show up to class/study. Final is NOT cumulative! You would never know this is his first semester. Manages to make a 200 person lecture hall class interesting! Small groups for discussions that are easy as well! TAKE HIM

He's the best professor I have had and he's a new KSU professor!He really cares about students! Easy A if you show up and do your work! 7 easy online exams which he gives a study guide for (lowest is dropped). No cumulative final! Easy written assignments that only have to be 250 words. Take him if you can!! and he gives extra credit!

He really cares about his students. He wants participation and is open to a lot of different opinions. His tests are online and every week you have a write an "essay" that is easy. Take him, you won't regret it!!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great professor! His lectures are entertaining, and he mostly  shows funny videos. 7 easy exams and the final is NOT cumulative. Very nice guy. Easy A, so def take him!
His lectures are great. He incorporates a lot of videos throughout his lectures. Attendance is mandatory but the class is very engaging. Take his class it is an easy A

He is a great professor! Easy A!  You do have small writing assignments due every other week, but they are easy and mostly based on your opinion. We have lecture on Monday and group discussions on Wednesdays.
